result.execSummary:
The defendant Mylah Sharmice Hatchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, all costs and disbursements within 18months of today's date (by 11-9-15). Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

4 months straight time; no release; 8 months to be with release to the CJRC program. Defendant advised of voting ineligibility. Remain controlled substance and alcohol free. Urine screens. Parenting classes/course. Obtain GED. Seek and maintain employment. Job and vocational training. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if one has not been previously provided, and pay DNA surcharge. Court set restitution at zero. No contact with the Sunglass Hut at Mayfair Mall, city of Wauwatosa, county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin. No contact with Rydear D.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mylah Sharmice Hatchett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Mylah Sharmice Hatchett not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Mylah Sharmice Hatchett in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Mylah Sharmice Hatchett in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
